title: Los Angeles/South Central
name: Natural History Museum of Los Angeles County
price: $12 adults, $9 teens (13-17)/college students/seniors (62+), $5 children (3-12), free for children under 3
content: A crown jewel of Los Angeles' museums. A national leader in exhibitions, education and research, the Museum was L.A.'s first cultural institution to open its doors to the public in 1913. It is the largest natural and historical museum in the Western United States, safeguarding more than 35 million spectacular, diverse specimens and artifacts.
